intro: Alsine verna var. mediterranea, commonly known as Mediterranean sandwort, is a low-growing, annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically features small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are often succulent and fleshy. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it common in rocky or sandy habitats. It is characterized by its ability to tolerate drought and poor soil conditions. Its botanical structure includes a taproot system and a basal rosette of leaves.
